channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.description:
Report E-2024110202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:47 EST, ERTS was contacted by of XPO Logistics (XCN) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .5 cup of Low Temp Draw Salt White (hazardous - UN1487) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. Terminal personnel advised they had the proper PPE, ventilation and poly drum to put product waste.

item.title: Report E-2024110190
item.description:
Report E-2024110190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0254 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Meritech Boot Cleaner XP Solution was released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to improper bracing and blocking by terminal BIN. The release impacted trailer #3212451. The spill was contained inside the box. Terminal Personnel placed the box into a 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report I-2024110023
item.description:
Report I-2024110023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5001
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a HFS tank. He verified the tank, quantity, product, and connections before starting to air. The driver started the air and soon after it started to leak product from the top dome. The driver immediately shut it down and notified the customer and his supervisor. The customer blocked off the nearest sewer drain with boom and absorbent. A third party cleanup contractor was sent in to neutralize and remove the product that was released. The cause of the release was determined to be over filled product.

item.title: Report E-2024110158
item.description:
Report E-2024110158

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCO experienced a UN3295 Odorless Mineral Spirits release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents and placed into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor III Christopher Lewis contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Christopher stated that while they were unloading a 55-gallon plastic drum of UN1814, Potassium Hydroxide, Solution, 8, PG II, when they noticed that the drum was leaking around the cap. Christopher stated that roughly 1-ounce leaked on top of the drum. Christopher stated they moved the 55-gallon plastic drum to the Hazmat Bay.

item.title: Report E-2024110054
item.description:
Report E-2024110054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1907 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XUR. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Potassium perchlorate released from a 50-pound plastic bag due to improper loading by the shipper. The bag has a rip in it and is still wrapped on the pallet. The release impacted trailer #4633605 at dock door 14. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of Potassium Perchlorate product released to a 1x1’ area of the trailer floor due to bag being overfilled and excess product leaking from seam. They added cardboard bracing behind shrink-wrap to the area which had the release underneath, to add as extra layer of protection. The contractors containerized floor sweepings of product into (1) 55-gallon metal drum (with vented bung caps). The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110013
item.description:
Report E-2024110013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 25, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pail of product were collected and containerized in two (2) 15-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110014
item.description:
Report E-2024110014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 25, 2024, four (4) 50-pound bags of UN1487 were torn in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) pound of product to the top of the bag. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged bags were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110012
item.description:
Report E-2024110012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 23, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon jugs of hydrogen peroxide were damaged in a freight handling incident and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged jugs in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal. TLE personnel then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All hydrogen peroxide-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110009
item.description:
Report E-2024110009

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T12:32:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0844 ET, XAY notified ERTS of a quart release of UN1263, Factory Pack Yellow Premium Basecoat released from at least 1 quart container inside a carton (holds 4 containers) due to improper loading from terminal XDE The spill was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill and containerizing waste into a 55-gallon metal drum.
